citation.article-title: Donghaeana dokdonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from sea water
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Donghaeana (Dong.hae.a′na. Donghae, the Korean name of the East Sea in Korea; L. fem. suff. -ana, suffix used with the sense of belonging to; N.L. fem. adj. used as a substantive Donghaeana pertaining to the East Sea of Korea, where Dokdo is located).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, rods or elongated rods (0·4–0·6×1·0–30·0 μm).
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, unidentified phospholipids and amino-group-containing lipids that are ninhydrin-positive.
The type species is Donghaeana dokdonensis.
